section.p: After calling this method, the SDK stops audio and video interactions, leaves the current channel, and releases all session-related resources. You must call this method after successfully joining a channel to end the call, otherwise you cannot start a new one.

ul.li: This method is asynchronous. The return does not mean you have actually left the channel.
If you have joined multiple channels using , calling this method leaves all joined channels.

note.ph: If you call immediately after this method, the SDK will not trigger the callback.

section.title: Timing
section.p: Call this method after joining a channel.

section.title: Related Callbacks
section.p:
After successfully calling this method to leave the channel, the following callbacks are triggered:

Remote: When a host leaves the channel, the remote side triggers .

plentry.pd: Callback after successfully leaving the channel, providing call statistics. See .

ul.li:
< 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and suggestions.
-1: General error (not specifically classified).
-2: Invalid parameter.
-7: SDK not initialized.
